Is Gun Buy Back Programs a good ideal ? 
 
 http://www.youdebate.com/DEBATES/gun_buy_back.HTM

Do the math. Two hundred million firearms are privately owned in this country. A custom hunting rifle can be as much as 4 thousand dollars. Collector grade firarms can be priceless. A well built inexpensive modern pistol can be about 300-400 dollars. A modern inexpensive duty shot gun can be about 200-250 dollars.
 
 If the government just paid $100 dollars for every firearm, that would be = 20 BILLION dollars.
 
 Anyone still think a gun buy back is a good idea?
hehe how about the gov't just lets us keep the guns? Save them all that expense. :D
I'm afraid of guns... makes me wish I had one. I wouldn't want it and they'll pay me for it... excellent! lol

Originally posted by Broker 
 I'm afraid of guns... makes me wish I had one. I wouldn't want it and they'll pay me for it... excellent! lol 
 
 
 why are you afraid of guns? has one jumped up and shot at you? you should never fear a gun, respect the gun.
Yeah... not going to help. Guns scare me, period.
I am honestly interested, why do they scare you?
aahh! all you need is training, Broker!

I don't want to hold a firearm, and all the training in the world isn't going to change that. 
 
 I'm sorry, but I would like to take your guns away. Don't label me liberal, either. Oh, here come the stones... make that bullets.

hmmm you are right Broker. You don't need training... you need INDOCTRINATION!! :D
 
 I know you aren't a liberal, and you shock me greatly! Yikes! :D
I just don't like guns... it's like me and keeping things clean--they call me an obsessive compulsive on that one. lol

Broker you dont like guns, but how do you feel about other people liking guns? i have nothing against people not liking guns and not wanting them in their homes, but when they try to be the morality police about other people having them, then that XXXXXX me off.
I think we should eliminate projectile guns altogether... I'd like to see a switch to high power stun weapons, so no one can be hurt.
Broker, if you make that comment in a more suitable thread, I'll debate you.

Originally posted by Broker 
 I think we should eliminate projectile guns altogether... I'd like to see a switch to high power stun weapons, so no one can be hurt. 
 
 
 Sorry you feel like that. But in a fight to the death there are no rules of decent society. I will cheat and use every advantage I can get to stop a felon trying to take my life.
 
 When the police use a stun gun, his partner is standing right next to him as a backup with a 12-guage shotgun. When you sign up for that stun gun, buy then extra optional accessory of a partner with a 12-guage shotgun.
What's the difference between the two? One won't kill no matter how it is used.
Would you trust your life to a stun gun? The police don't.
I don't care what they will and won't do. They don't think a stun gun is as capable of doing the job.

You should be worried if you are just armed with a stun gun to defend yourself. You are better off with a good pair of sneakers so you can run away. I'm not kidding. 
 
 If I were given a choice of using a stun gun and running away. I would run away first so I could call 911.
 
 Running away from danger is always the best choice, armed or not, but more so with a stun gun.
 
 You have only one shot. Better not miss. Felons rarely work alone. Better carry 2 stun guns, one for his partner.

yeah, I don't think i want to trust my life to a stun gun. that "only one shot" deal is NOT appealing. 
 
 
 Also, you may not have known this Broker, but stun guns can/have killed people. So why not carry a gun?

This isn't going to get anywhere... I don't want projectile weapons for civilian use, local government use. Only keep them for the military. Guns do good and guns do bad. I would like a weapon that only kills in very rare cases.
 
 I know I can't convince you gun lovers...
you put alot of trust in your government to protect you dont ya broker?
We control the government...of course I trust it.
What with the vote that goes to whoever has the biggest wallet and the smoothest tongue? Americans are the most easliy manipulated people in the world.

stun guns are extremely worthless
 
 there are several of other types of non lethal weapons, which are much stronger than stun guns
 
 -- Anti-traction technology: Teflon-type environmentally neutral lubricants that make footholds or traction exceedingly difficult. A product of this type can be used to deny access to areas or to cover a unit's flank.
 -- Sticky foam: Extremely adhesive foam that immobilizes individuals. This foam can be used to subdue an individual or reinforce obstacles.
 -- Infrasound: Low-frequency sound generators that incapacitate individuals by causing nausea, disorientation and bowel spasms.
 -- Microwave transmitters: Directionally oriented devices that heat skin to an unbearable degree as people approach them.
 -- Lasers: Personnel-portable and vehicle-mounted flashers designed to dazzle but not permanently injure eyes.
 -- Electrical shockers: Stand-off, hand-launched, electrical shock projectiles.
 -- Pyrotechnics: Rapid-bloom smoke grenades and enhanced smoke grenades.
 -- Vortex weapons: The vortex gun fires a doughnut-shaped shock wave, powerful enough to knock people down. The gun can also be filled with a riot-control agent such as pepper spray that disperses a chemical irritant as well as knocks a person down.
 
 
 
 http://www.washtimes.com/upi-breaking/20021030-063607-9176r.htm

At any time we can stop supporting our government. If all of us hate it it stops the government. We can refuse to pay all taxes, shuts things down financially and that kills the government. A government here without our support isn't going to be here for long.

to do that, Broker, you need a pretty darn large percentage of the population to agree with you. Of course, now that you mention it... the last time that happened in america, there was a war of independence.... man, they used guns! :D

Gun buy backs are a good idea if it is a private organization, dont waste my tax money on it. Well actually they are a bad idea, a good place to dump a murder weapon isn't it. I wish one would come around my area, I have some old junk guns that I cant get working that I would love to trade for cash. I wish HCI or whatever they are called now would come to Shreveport and give money for guns I would get my friends together and bankrupt them. And another thing why is it called a "buy back" The gov't has never owned my weapons nor has Sarah Brady. I would love to meet the person who thought this up, they have never been even remotely associated with a drop in crime or accidents, just a waste of money.

We control the government...of course I trust it.

 no! i believe the govt controls or wants to control us!

You have the right to be opposed to guns and to voice your opinion, but I ask you as another human being not to try to take away my right to protection. 
 
 We live by different idiologies, but that doesn't mean that we can't live together with a mutual respect for eachother's rights.

no! i believe the govt controls or wants to control us!
